**Book Title:**
Scope & Closures
**Chapter:**
apA.md
**Section Title:**
 `var` *and* `let`
**Topic:**
example code

The example code will cause a SyntaxError: Unexpected token '.'  by `record.name`.

```js
function getStudents(data) {
    var studentRecords = [];

    for (let record of data.records) {
        let id = `student-${ record.id }`;
        studentRecords.push({
            id,
            record.name  // <---- SyntaxError: Unexpected token '.', fixed this line to `name: record.name`
        });
    }

    return studentRecords;
}
```
```
             record.name
                  ^

SyntaxError: Unexpected token '.'
    at wrapSafe (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1001:16)
    at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1049:27)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1114:10)
    at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:950:32)
    at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:790:12)
    at Function.executeUserEntryPoint [as runMain] (internal/modules/run_main.js:76:12)
    at internal/main/run_main_module.js:17:47
```

 _but_ allowing -> **by** allowing.

There is a small typo in get-started/ch1.md.

Should read `transpilation` rather than `transpiliation`.

The original code shows:
```
obj.a;			// 12
obj.b;			// 30
obj.c;			// 3
```

But I made the calculation and the result must be:
```
obj.a;			// 6
obj.b;			// 33
obj.c;			// 3
```

Because we call to `changeObj( 3, 11 );` and:
```
	obj.a = a * 2;
	obj.b = b * 3;
```

The final value of the property `c` is OK because `a + b + old value of c` is `6 + 33 + 3` that is `42`.

Thanks!

Modified the example for toggle. A bit more compact and uses arguments. I found it a bit more easier, as we are not doing any operations on the array like shift / unshift. 

```javascript
function toggle(){
    var i = 0
    var list = arguments
    return function(){
      if(i===list.length)
         i = 0
      return list[i++]    
    }
}
```

## Note

We didn't make any changes, Just a few more files (related to gitbook).

In order to be able to read it like a book, easier to read.

Now the reader just needs to clone the repository for download, and simply run a command in the repository to open the book in the browser.
There is a catalog with instructions, and you can also customize the gitbook plug-in, customized exquisite books.

I think everyone needs better reading habits.

Add Some file:

- `SUMMARY.md` Gitbook Summary
- `book.json` Gitbook Config(plugin)
- `styles/` gitbook style(css file)

**Section Title:**

**Topic:**

1. In the **Operators `||` and `&&`** section, there is a sentence that says:
```
If the test is `false`, the `&&` expression results in the value of the *first operand* (`a` or `c`)
```
For example:
```javascript
console.log(true && '')
```
It will result in the second operand.

2. In the **Abstract Relational Comparison section** you said:
```
The algorithm first calls `ToPrimitive` coercion on both values, and if the return result of either call is not a `string`, then both values are coerced to `number` values using the `ToNumber` operation rules, and compared numerically
```
Which its example is wrong because they have been compared alphabetically:
```javascript
[42] < ["43"]
```
Because `[42]` will be "42" and after that "42" will be compared to "43".
As I explained:
```javascript
[42] < ["043"] // false
```

When you call "abc".match( RegExp.prototype ) the console will give an error:  Method RegExp.prototype.exec called on incompatible receiver [object Object]

To avoid this, you need to convert RegExp.prototype to a String, like this:

 "abc".match( RegExp.prototype.toString() ); "null"

which returns null because the match method could not find any string with the pattern of "/(?:)/".

When match finds something it will return an Array Object, for example: "abc".match(/ab/); returns ["ab"];

"但它不被允许是因为引擎的实现者发现，在设置时检查（并拒绝！）无限循环引用一次，要比每次你在一个对象上查询属性时都做相同检查的性能要高。"
这句话，目前翻译的意思为："无限循环引用"要比"每次在一个对象上查询属性"的性能要高。前者性能比后者好，为什么我们还要不允许使用呢？
回顾在英文版原文中提到："But it's disallowed because engine implementors have observed that it's more performant to check for (and reject!) the infinite circular reference once at set-time rather than needing to have the performance hit of that guard check every time you look-up a property on an object." 注意这里："that it's more performant to check" 个人理解应该翻译为消耗(花费)更多的性能，而不是性能更高。并且，综合文章上下文来看，相互委托不允许被使用，是引擎实现者发现的是"无限循环引用"比"在一个对象上查询"更消耗性能，所以才不允许使用。
综上，建议把"都做相同检查的性能要高"替换为"都做相同检查消耗的性能要高"

In the base/original: If the 'bank_balance' variable were less than 209.97 but greater than 199.98, the old expression would evaluate and claim we could afford the extra purchase, but we wouldn't actually be able to afford it because the bank balance would be less than the 'amount' + 'ACCESSORY_PRICE'.

In my PR: affordability is determined by adding both the 'amount' variable and 'ACCESSORY_PRICE' constant and then checking if that total is less than the 'bank_balance' variable.

How strict is the typing (strong/weak) is orthogonal to when is the
type information available (static/runtime).

So saying that a strong typed language is static is not necessarily true.

Samples:
- Erlang is Strong-Dynamically typed
- C is Weak-Static typed (because of void*)
